native.translation[0].definitions[0].def: your native country, town etc is the place where you were born
native.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They never saw their native land again.
He spent most of his professional life outside his native Poland.
native.translation[0].definitions[1].def: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
native.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Singapore has many native species of palm.
These fish are native to North America.
native.translation[0].definitions[2].def: native customs, traditions etc are related to people who lived in a particular country before European people arrived there
native.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a native ability is one that you have naturally from birth
native.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a person who was born in a particular place
native.translation[1].definitions[1].def: someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time
native.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He has become a native of Glasgow.
native.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a word used by white people in the past to refer to the people who lived in America, Africa, southern Asia etc before European people arrived, now considered offensive
native.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: He was not certain whether the natives were friendly.
native.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a plant or animal that grows or lives naturally in a place
native.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: The bear was once a native of Britain.
